title: Textile, "Rodef Shalom synagogue curtain trial", 1963–64
medium:
Medium: silk, metalized plastic film wrapped around a viscose rayon core, and flat metalized plastic yarns 
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
Label: brocaded silk and synthetic metallic yarns
inscribed: Label sewn on bottom left hand corner, "Trude Guermonprez - Handwoven" Handwrittten hanging cardboard tag, "SYNAGOGUE SAMPLE (RODEF SHOLOM) (1963-64)"
dimensions: H x W: 193 x 94 cm (76 x 37 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Curtain panel woven in off-white silk with gold metallic wefts which form open vertical stripes. With brocaded squares of  yellow, pink, orange and purple densely applied at the top and more sparsely in the lower two-thirds. Sample for Temple Rodef Sholom, San Rafael, California.

tombstone.epitaph:

1963–64. Medium: silk, metalized plastic film wrapped around a viscose rayon core, and flat metalized plastic yarns
